data.title: Develop3d : Changes to allow MonoMac and iOS stuff to build with new GLSL Shader changes
data.body: Changes to allow both Mac and iOS to compile on the develop3d branch. iOS needed changes to support GLSLShader.cs

data.title: Develop3d: Linux build fixes
Retina Display
data.body: What happened to retina display (@2x) files? They are not loading anymore on newer versions?

data.title: StorageDevice/StorageContainer error on Device
data.body:
When I try to use the StorageDevice/StorageContainer ON THE DEVICE it throws a ExecutionEngineException...

Unhandled Exception: System.ExecutionEngineException: Attempting to JIT compile method '(wrapper runtime-invoke) <Module>:runtime_invoke_object__this___Nullable`1<PlayerIndex>_int_int (object,intptr,intptr,intptr)' while running with --aot-only.

[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.ExecutionEngineException: Attempting to JIT compile method '(wrapper runtime-invoke) <Module>:runtime_invoke_object__this___Nullable`1<PlayerIndex>_int_int (object,intptr,intptr,intptr)' while running with --aot-only.

This happens only when linking on the device.

First I tried to use the StorageDevice/StorageContainer on my game, then it didn't worked, so I tried running the AlienGame StarterKit, newest version, and it was also not as working, so the StarterKit also has this bug.

data.title: Update origin from upstream
Merge latest updates with origin
Fixed a bug in the Windows/Linux and Mac Ports
Develop3d - Changes to fix/optimize texture loading, complete bounding frustum/sphere test, and some platform-specific changes
data.body:
Add ignore = all to each submodule to prevent changes showing in a git status of the outer directory.
List supported GL extensions when GraphicsDevice is initalized.
Cache Android's activity asset file list on first use to avoid getting the same list for every filename that goes through ContentTypeReader.Normalize().
Handle the case where IEnumerable.FirstOrDefault() returns null (string default) when the file is not found. Avoids crash in Path.Combine().
Garbage-free DXT decompression. Appears to also solve debugger drop-out on Android.
Shift channels when loading BGRA4444 from XNB.
Swap R and B channels in Texture2D.LoadFromStream on Android.
Alternate implementation for BoundingFrustum.Contains(BoundingSphere) that covers all cases.
Reset lastUpdateTime in Game.ResetElapsedTime, though it still does not appear to work fully.
Fix MojoShader alloc/free members that caused JIT errors in MonoTouch.
GraphicsExtensions: iOS does not like Rgba4 as an internal format.
If graphics device does not exist when frame buffer is created, set it later when the graphics device is created.
Fixed sign test of previous change to bounding frustum test.
Defined out iOS-specific code in GraphicsDeviceManager.cs.
Implement list of disposable assets as a separate list, as required by the optional disposable handler in ReadAsset().

data.title: iOS - SpriceBatch.cs
update VideoPlayer constructor contract to match XNA 4
data.body:
- use Game.Instance to get the "game instance"

(this is from pull request #73 redone against current "develop" branch)

data.title: Fixed a Matrix issue with the Android SpriteBatch.cs
data.body: Fixed a Matrix issue with the Android SpriteBatch.cs . The SpriteBatch transform matrix was not being applied in the gles 2.0 profile

data.title: Android Changes .... Lots of them
data.body:
ContentManager  - Moved the LzDecoder out of the Read method to a field as it was just being reused all the time, not need to keep creating one.

SpriteBatch - Changed all the matrix4 for Matrix to so we dont have to do any conversions. OpenGL can take the XNA Matrix class anyway. Fix the orientation under android. We were updating the Viewport and Matrix before the Display width and height had changed which resulted in a weird view of the game.

Texture2D & TextureReader - Changed to allow us to Scale Bitmaps when loading from xnb files under GL 1.1. The Texture coords are still off and need fixing. 

MonoGamePeer - Updated to attempt to get the Guid of the host app for identifing the game so different games do not detect each other.

Added some of sdancers Compatability changes

data.title: Develop3d - Initial support for GLSL shaders for Base Effects and custom shader effects written in GLSL
data.body:
### Initial support for GLSL shaders

The base is there but still needs lot's of clean up.  Just want to get it out there.  Only SpriteEffect is implemented at this time.
### Added support for GLSL_EFFECTS compiler directive

By specifying the compiler directive we can test both scenarios of HLSL or GLSL
### Needs lots of clean up of the code

Code needs to be cleaned up as there are still missing support for a lot of things.

data.title: develop: Force pow2 resizing in ES2.0 to make textures appear in Platformer sample on Android
data.body: Further checks to be done in other samples.

data.title: develop: Fix for issue #280: Return type of TouchCollection.FindById was incorrect.
data.body:
Existing FindById returning an int was refactored to FindIndexById as iOSGameWindow and AndroidGameWindow used it for updating the touch state.
Added FindById that returned a bool to match XNA 4.0 API.
Removed internal List<> helper in TouchCollection that would have caused memory allocations per frame.

data.title: develop : iOS - Touch location is wrong landscape mode..
data.body:
Load up the port Input sample. In portrait mode, the Touch location is virtually spot on in the simulator
When you rotate to landscape mode, the touch location appears off to the right.

data.title: develop : iOS - When in Landscape mode, everything is stretched.
data.body: Load up the Draw2D or Orientation sample under iOS, in Portrait mode everything appears to draw correctly, however when you switch to Landscape mode everything looks stretched.

data.title: develop: Issue 191: Added VertexPositionColorTexture.cs to iOS project
Textures not resized
data.body:
I'm currently trying the XNA tutorial from this site: http://www.riemers.net/eng/Tutorials/XNA/Csharp/Series2D/Positioning_images.php

However it seems that the textures aren't resizes to the PreferredBackBuffer[Width|Height] or the full Graphics areN#t set to this size as device.PresentationParameters.BackBufferWidth outputs something dfferent from what I set.

My version is the latest git develop and OS is Linux (Fedora 16). If you need more info, please tell me!

data.title: Develop3d - Android changes to get it up-to-date
data.body:
Removed a lot of Android specific files and merged them into common source files.
Requires Android/libmojoshader.so from ThirdParty/Libs added to your game project.

data.title: Monogame on iOS: different behavior when interpreting touches compared to Windows Phone
Develop3d: Fix tests and various graphics things
data.body:
-Basic implementation of Texture2D.GetData (fixes tests)
-Port FlyingDev's Color fixes (makes Texture2D.GetData nicer)
-Clear the effect object cache (was breaking tests due to use of invalid shader objects)
-Fix Blend.SourceColor (MonoTouch's enum isn't right)
-Fix effects that lack vertex shaders (posfixup wasn't being set correctly)
-Implement Dispose on Texture and RenderTarget2D
-Fix SpriteBatch draw location rounding. Fixes some of the visual tests

data.title: Various graphics fixes and refactorings
data.body:
-Apply d3d/ogl rendering fixup to shaders
-Port over flyingdev's Texture2D, ours was crufty (unified Texture2D!)
    -Need to re-implement some of the clobbered methods...
-Get rid of ESImage and ESTexture2D, they weren't a big help and were annoying
-Read Texture2D mipmap levels
-Fix TextureCube calls, though still broken
-Fix the DXShader uniform order when arrays are involved
    -Feels like a bug in MojoShader, need to investigate and solve properly

-Cache effect objects (was causing massive memory usage in performance test)
-Use static initialiser for GLSLOptimizer

And, just to be a little out of place

-Fix resizing bug on Windows
-Implement SongReader

data.title: Monogame templates for Monodevelop no longer work
data.body:
Hi,

the README states to "Drag and Drop the directory MonoDevelop.MonoGame.1.6.0 into ~/.config/MonoDevelop/addins" to install the Monogame templates.
However, this no longer works.
Here's the reply from Xamarin regarding this issue:

The ~/.config/MonoDevelop was used for MD 2.4 and earlier, but we migrated to a new layout in 2.6 and later: http://monodevelop.com/Developers/Articles/User_Profiles. In particular, addins for MD 2.8 on Mac would go in ~/Library/Application Support/MonoDevelop-2.8/Addins. However, it would be better for MonoGame to convert their addin into an mpack package using "mdtool setup pack", so that it could be installed via the Addin Manager.
